body.name: Basketful of Heads (Hill House Comics)
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Joe Hill is the #1 New York Times bestselling author of The Fireman and Heart-Shaped Box. His second novel, Horns, was made into a feature film starring Daniel Radcliffe; his third, NOS4A2, is forthcoming as a TV series from AMC. His book of short stories, 20th Century Ghosts, won the Bram Stoker Award and British Fantasy Award for Best Collection. His most recent work, Strange Weather, a collection of novellas, was published in the autumn of 2017. He earned the Eisner Award for Best Writer for his long-running comic book series Locke & Key, featuring the eye-popping art of Gabriel Rodriguez. Look for that one as a Netflix show in the not-too-distant future.

body.description: #1 New York Times bestselling author Joe Hill asks, "With a cursed Viking axe, what can you accomplish?" and June Branch is ready to answer!Heads will roll...June Branch is in trouble. She's trapped on Brody Island with nowhere to run. Her boyfriend, Liam, has been kidnapped. And four bloodthirsty escaped convicts will stop at nothing to find her.All poor June has to defend herself with is a strange Viking axe with the terrifying power to decapitate a person and leave their head still talking. If she's going to save Liam and herself, June will have to keep a cool head...or even a whole basketful of them!From #1 New York Times bestselling writer Joe Hill (NOS4A2, Locke & Key) comes Basketful of Heads, the first series in the smash-hit lineup of the Hill House Comics library. Featuring incredible artwork by Leomacs (Lucifer), this spine-tingling collection includes the entire seven-issue miniseries, as well as character designs and behind-the-scenes sketches.Collects issues #1-7.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Joe Hill has a wicked sense of the world, and I, for one, hope he continues creating these fantabulous fantasy stories that enable me (& many others) to actually see his vision - this graphic novel goes above & beyond, the illustrations are magnificent; I’m so happy I got this!

reviews.reviewerName: Rebecca W. - Read It Review It Book Blog
reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Funny and entertaining
reviews.reviewText: I might be in the minority but I find real humor in some horror. This one brings the outrageous by the barrels or by the basket full I guess. Definitely a must read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It's shorter than I expected but still great
reviews.reviewText: It's shorter than I expected but still great. I wasn't exactly that surprised with the true reveals of the bad guys and their real plan. If it was longer I think it could've been better, but it was still well done. Not as scary as I expected, either.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars If you haven't read this yet your in for a treat
reviews.reviewText: Definitely a great one the way the story twists over and over I never really seen the end coming the way it did Joe hill is becoming one of my favorite writers just WOW blew my mind

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong Female Lead
reviews.reviewText: June is strong, smart & a great female protagonist! It’s also great to see Mrs. Thurston is smart & sneaky as well! Loved the illustrations as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I think that Joe Hill may be as deranged as his father. I mean that in the best possible way.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazing horror comic
reviews.reviewText: I love Joe's writing. The art is the cherry on top. If you enjoy old school horror comics, this is for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Dark and stormy…
reviews.reviewText: Great story and action. Starts with a sunny, promising day by the seaside, but things get real dark real fast. A nice use of the trope of the right person accidentally grabbing a supernatural weapon to defend themself and becoming a bad a$$ - iron willed warrior. This story is as much an action tale as anything else, and I liked the fun twist (or two) at the end.
La historia y la ilustracion estan muy padre. Me atrapo y lo lei muy rápido. Totalmente recomendable!
This was a comic I couldn't put down. However, I thought their would be more to it. Either way it was good

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I loved every second of this! It was gruesome, exciting, and the end was fantastic! S is definitely worth the read!

What a ride this comics is. The art, the story and the whole mountain of an absurd concept. This comic plays like a movie enthralling you with every decapitated head and an ending that will leave you with a "Oh! Damn." feeling.
Joe Hill writes interesting stories. This story has a very cinematic feeling to it. Loved it.
